args:
After Tobias hears the truth about Nino's
ancestor, the Goddess Ilia, they flee the hidden
village toward a town with a perditionist priest.
But his betrayal leaves them cornered until the
apostle Ryszarda comes to their rescue.
Yes. I...had no idea my charm held such\npower. Is this what that rhyme meant?
Old words, passed down in my family.\n＂When there shall come a soul of light,\nthy gem shall shine and grant thee flight.＂
The gem that became your armor is a\nprotective charm my ancestor left behind\na thousand years ago.
Then that would make it a holy relic...\nMeaning this armor is the work of the\nGoddess Herself.
Hey. You came here without knowing\nanything, right?
What do you believe? About me being a\ndescendant of Ilia, I mean.
Honestly? I'm not sure. But I certainly\ndon't see that as a reason to attack you\nas Goma did.
My faith lies not in history, but in the will\nof the Goddess that all life shall find\npeace.
...I believe you. I can tell from the look\nin your eyes that you're a sincere guy.
Sonniere's dying wish was that I come\nhere and protect you. Regrettably, he...\npassed on before I could ask more.
So please, tell me. About your family.\nWhy is the conservative sect after you?
It's so many generations back that there's\nno way of knowing for sure, but...here's\nhow my people have always told it.

A thousand years ago, a girl named Ilia saved the
world from calamity, ending the war between man
and dragonkind by uniting them under a common
banner. In the end, she gave her life to stop the
threat by throwing herself into the Otherworld.

But the faerie who raised her feared news of Ilia's
death could see the nascent alliance between man
and dragon unravel, so she tore off her own wings
and took Ilia's name, traveling the land in human
guise to preach peace between the races.
And so the Ilian Church was born. The Goddess\nknown to the outside world is in fact that wingless\nfaerie—
—and my distant ancestor,\nif the tales are true.
Human, as far as I know. The moment she\nlost her wings, my ancestor lost her faerie\npowers, or so the story goes.
And when that ancestor died, there was a\nbig fight over who would lead the Church\nnext.
They were divided between those who\nwanted a blood heir to inherit the position\nand those who wanted someone new.
In the end, the hereditary faction lost.\nFearing a purge, they cast a massive-scale\nspell to hide those blood heirs here.
So... Sonniere was involved with that\nhereditary faction?
Yes, he's one of their descendants.\nThey call their organization the Lineage\nCouncil.
They've hidden our family line here ever\nsince, even from the Pope, and support us\nfrom the outside world.
For its part, the Church buried any record\nof a battle for succession. I'd been told the\noutside world forgot that we exist. But...
But Goma and his knights came for you.\nAnd with a chime in their possession.
I have no idea how they learned about us.
Or how they managed to steal the chime\noff a member of the Lineage Council.
I see. Sonniere must have noticed they\nwere on the move and called for me...
Do you think they'll come back?\nThose knights, I mean?
I can't imagine they'd give up so soon.\nNino, we need to leave the village. Now.
What? Leave the... I can do that?
It isn't safe here. I will see that you make\nit to somewhere that is.
The Town of Purgatorum\nPerditionist Priest's Parish
And so you fought with the conservatives?\nI see. You are welcome to take refuge in\nour town for now.
I could not turn a fellow in faith away,\nTobias. And who is the young lady?
His little sister. Isn't that right, Toby?
My feet are killing me, Toby.\nLet's hurry to our lodgings.
Wait for me, Nino.\nEr, if you'll excuse us, Father.
To think she would come to me...\nThe Goddess smiles upon me today.
Why lie about being my sister?
Because there's no guarantee that priest\nwill accept the story of my family line.

Father Glennie is an ally in excising the
rot that ails the Church. He hopes that
the Scrolls of Perdition will spark reform,
as do I.
He is no slave to the old ways. I see\nno reason for him to reject your claim.
That's right—you're a part of that\n＂perditionist＂ sect.
Sonniere told me about you people. That\nthe Church is divided right now over those\nScrolls of Perdition.
What led you to side the way you did?
My first mission as a Paladyn was to\nsubdue unrest in a particular diocese. The\ncause was the Church's own degeneracy.
If the faith has devolved into something\nthat claims innocent lives, it is a relic best\nburied and forgotten.

And so the scrolls' discovery gave me
hope. If they'd incite the winds of change
to blow through the Church, then fewer
lives would be so needlessly lost.
And yet they've caused fresh blood to spill,\nfrom what I've heard. You're fine with that?
In the past, I told myself that sacrifices\nwere inevitable in the pursuit of progress.\nBut now...
I think less on hope and more on what I\ncan be doing myself to better the lot of\nthose around me.
I have to say, you're not like any Church\npeople I've met.
Looking to your future, I propose we make\nfor the Halidom once things simmer down.\nMy acquaintance there will—
Who speaks?! Ah... The door!\nThere's smoke coming in around it!
Poison! We need to get clear of it!
We're leaving through the window! It's\ngoing to be rough, so hang on tight!\n...HaaaAAAH!
I had hoped you'd be too weary to slip\naway. Alas...
Glennie?! Then that smoke was... No!
Yes! Given how close you two seemed,\nI thought this the surest way to pry her\nfrom you.
So it's her you're after? Why?
You needn't feign ignorance. I know she's\nthe Goddess's scion the Lineage Council's\nkept hidden away.
Let me guess: you think I'm a lying heretic\ntoo.
I'm not like those stubborn conservatives.\nA true believer is able to accept all truths.
Then why set your aim on taking her life?
I pray for peace and harmony among all\nIlia's faithful. Her existence is anathema\nto that noble goal.
Using the key she holds to bring the whole\ntruth to light is a far more efficient answer.
You needn't know. Do your sacred duty and\nhand the girl over. Else I'll have to ask\nthese gentlemen to take her.
(Ngh... I inhaled too much of that smoke.\nMy limbs feel heavy as lead. Can I get us\nout of this?)
I'm afraid your little designs end here.\nHraaah!
Allies of justice, just passing through the\nneighborhood. We'll be taking those two\nwith us, please and thanks.
*cough* *cough* Rgh, they've escaped!\nBut they can't have run far.
Serves me right for entrusting this to the\ntown guard, instead of the more capable\nalternative...
